org.t2health.lib.widget
Class AbsoluteLayout

java.lang.Object
  ViewGroup
      org.t2health.lib.widget.AbsoluteLayout

NOTE: For 99% of all cases, you will NOT need to use this layout. Before
 you even consider using this layout try LinearLayout. It will fit most of
 your needs. If you really want to use this layout, speak to a senior
 Android developer.
 
 A layout that lets you specify exact locations (x/y coordinates) of its
 children. Absolute layouts are less flexible and harder to maintain than
 other types of layouts without absolute positioning.

 
XML attributes
 
 See ViewGroup Attributes, View Attributes

 
 In order to use the layout_x, layout_y attributes in your XML layout, you
 will need to add the T2 namespace to the parent view. eg
 xmlns:t2="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/org.t2health.lib"
 
 Then you can set the layout_x by settings t2:layout_x="20" on the child 
 element of your choice.
